activities: INC Research, LLC and its subsidiaries (“INC Research”) provide services that include those that are related to clinical trials of all phases as well as post-marketing pharmacovigilance and surveillance activities. In conducting its operations, INC Research may collect and process data pertaining to clinical research participants; study investigators and their staff; medical and healthcare professionals; pharmaceutical industry experts and opinion leaders; customers such as pharmaceutical, medical device and biotechnology companies; vendors; contractors; consultants; and consumers. In addition, INC Research may also process human resources data from current, former, and potential employees. These data may be collected and transferred to INC Research, LLC and its subsidiaries in the U.S. in support of INC Research's business activities.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-Line, Off-Line, Manually Processed, Human Resources
recoursemech: European Union Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
